questions.question: What is the primary purpose of first aid?
options: To provide immediate help before professional assistance arrives

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a general rule of first aid?
options: Transfer the passenger to the hospital as soon as possible

questions.question: What is the correct order of priority for treatment according to the notes?
options: Shock, Severe Burns, Cardiac Arrest, Major Fracture
Cardiac Arrest, Severe Bleeding, Shock, Major Fracture
Multiple superficial injuries, Cardiac Arrest, Shock, Severe Bleeding
Severe Burns, Choking, Injuries to eyes, Severe Bleeding

questions.question: When handling a serious medical incident on board, what is the first action for crew?
options: Call for backup and inform the Pilot in Command (PIC)
Transfer the passenger to the galley

questions.question: Which pulse site is used for infants?
What is the normal resting pulse rate for a healthy adult?

options: Apply ice directly to the burn
Rinse under cool running water for 10–20 minutes

questions.question: Which item is found in the Medical Kit but NOT in the First Aid Kit?
When is epinephrine administered to a passenger with anaphylaxis?
options: 0.1 mg IM if mild allergic reaction
0.3 mg IM immediately if anaphylaxis is suspected

questions.question: What is the first step when a crew member identifies cardiac arrest?
options: Begin CPR with 30 compressions to 2 ventilations

questions.question: At what systolic blood pressure should Sorbitrate not be repeated in a suspected angina patient?
Which of the following is NOT a symptom of a cerebral stroke (U-FAST)?
For a suspected spinal injury, what is the first action by the crew?
options: Apply a cervical collar if suspected

questions.question: Which of the following treatments is correct for a sprain or strain?
What is the typical volume of air inhaled by an adult in one breath?
Which of these is NOT a cause of hyperventilation?
What is the recommended action if a convulsion lasts longer than 10 minutes?
Which dose of Crocin syrup should be given to a 4-year-old child for fever?
Which of the following is a sign of dehydration?
options: Loss of water and salt from the body

questions.question: What is the recommended treatment for otitic barotrauma during descent?
options: Apply cold compress to the ear

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct action for a patient with hypoglycemic coma who is unconscious?
During childbirth, what is the sign that labor has progressed to Stage 2?
Which position should a pregnant passenger be seated in for extra in-flight attention?
options: Exit row seat at the front
Aisle seat near the galley with padding under seat belt
Middle seat in the rear cabin

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT included in the UPK (Universal Precaution Kit)?
What is the primary symptom of nitrogen decompression sickness called “bends”?
options: Pain and swelling in the joints

questions.question: Which of the following is a correct first-aid treatment for a bee sting?
options: Rub the area vigorously to remove venom
Apply ice, Soframycin ointment, and Tab. Crocin if needed
Do not clean the wound; leave it dry

questions.question: What is the recommended dose of Tab. Meftal Spas for a 10-year-old child with abdominal pain?
Which anatomical structure is part of the upper extremity?
What should crew do if they suspect a cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) leak after a head injury?
options: Elevate head and shoulders, urgent hospitalization

questions.question: What is indicated by a dry and warm skin in a hyperglycemic coma?
Which treatment is appropriate for hiccups during flight?
options: Breathe in and out through an air sickness bag

questions.question: Which of the following items is essential before administering any medicine on board?
options: Ask if the passenger has eaten recently

questions.question: What is the correct crew action for a passenger experiencing panic attack or claustrophobia?
options: Relocate passenger to quieter space and ease breathing (R.E.S.T.)
Immediately page for doctor without intervention

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a sign of hypothermia?

In a case of severe bleeding, what is the recommended immediate action?
options: Elevate legs and give tea or coffee
Apply direct pressure to the wound
Page for a doctor only after bleeding stops

What is the correct action if a passenger with a suspected spinal injury needs to be moved?
options: Perform a blanket drag if required, with cervical support
Ask them to walk to the aisle before moving
Sit them upright and then move quickly

questions.question: Which of the following conditions is characterized by involuntary muscle contractions and frothing at the mouth?
What is the recommended crew action when managing a chemical burn (3rd degree)?
options: Rinse under running water for 10–20 minutes
Apply BACTIGRAS and urgent hospitalization; do not remove jewelry or apply ointments
Administer Tab. Crocin and monitor vitals every 10 minutes

questions.question: Which of the following drugs is used to treat diarrhea on board?

Which vital sign should be monitored every 10 minutes for severe head injuries?
Which first-aid measure is appropriate for an infant with febrile convulsion?
options: Cover the child with a blanket and give hot fluids
Sponging with tap water, open air vents, and give age-appropriate Crocin syrup
Restrain the infant and force-feed ORS
